intro: Rondeletia rekoi, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural gardens in warm climates.
